alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 6:10PM CDT until April 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Pittsburg and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcalester... Wilburton... Stigler... Hartshorne... Krebs... Quinton... Kiowa... Porum... Savanna... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Crowder... Whitefield... Alderson... Kinta... Canadian... Indianola... Ashland... Blocker... Higgins... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
